item.title: Five markets together, Chungju traditional market outing - Chungju, Chungbuk, Korea
item.description:
Chungju Free Market

Five markets together, Chungju traditional market outing

Chungju, Chungbuk, Korea

Each city must have one or two markets to offer. So, when you travel to each city, you can't miss the fun of going around the traditional market. Another market is waiting for Chungju. Free market, Muhak market, public market, Chungui market, and Pungmul market are gathered in one place along Chungju stream. The fact that several markets are gathered in one place is one of the biggest characteristics of Chungju traditional markets. It's like a huge market, but five different markets work together to bring you special fun.

Unique free market with market cafes and theaters
Let's go to the free market first. The free market is a market formed on the streets of Bukmun where the North Gate was, when Chungju-eupseong existed. Existing on the 5th day As the city was formed, it established itself as the current free market.
The free market tends to have more shops dealing with clothing, sandals, and fabrics than other places. In the past, there were many shops selling peppers, garlic, and rice, but it moved to the agricultural and fishery wholesale market in Chungju, opened in 1995, making it difficult to see the lively appearance as before.
Chungju Free Market
However, as the arcade was installed and registered as a recognized market in 2005, it is seeking change. The market has been cleaned up and new buildings such as customer support centers have been built.
Free cafe where customers visiting the market can rest
The Free Market Customer Support Center building has a free cafe and a jjimjilbang. The free cafe was decorated with pictures showing the history of the market and a well-equipped resting area. There is also a DJ booth where you can subscribe and listen to music. Various drinks are also available, but the price is low, ranging from 500 won to 1,500 won. You can enjoy coffee at half price if you bring a receipt issued in the free market.
Free cafe where customers visiting the market can rest
As you look around the market, you can see a unique building called Freedom Theater. Opened in 2012, it recreates the theater atmosphere of the 1970s and 1980s.
Free theater in free market
It is a special space in the market where you can watch old movies for free, but it is currently suspended due to management problems. Instead, movies are shown twice a day at the Free Cafe.
Free theater in free market
The best spot in Chungju traditional market, Sundae dumpling alley
If you want to enjoy eating, go to Sundae Dumpling Alley. Located in the alley between Muhak Market and Public Market leading from the free market, Sundae Mandu Alley is a must-see for visitors to Chungju Market.
Entrance to Sundae Dumpling Alley at Muhak Market
There are entrances to both Muhak Market and Public Market. The main character of this alley is Sundae and Mandu. Shops selling sundae and dumplings are lined up on either side of the street.
Delicious sundae
When entering the Sundae Alley, the hand dumplings made by the grandmothers and aunts and the ripening Sundae stimulate the taste, smell, and vision. If you sit down at a favorite store and sit down, it will make food on the fly.
Delicious sundae
In particular, Sundaeguk in Soondae Alley has a different taste of broth with siraegi. On one side, pour the boiling broth of Siraegi in a pot, and then cut the warm sundae sliced into pieces. Since it is Siraegi broth, it has a lighter and deeper taste.
Hearty soup
If the market is not as good as the market, it is often served with plenty of broth and tasted while waiting. The spaciousness, which is hard to find in ordinary restaurants, warms not only the stomach but also the heart.
Delicious hand dumplings
Some houses share sundae and dumplings, but most specialize in sundae or dumplings. You can also order dumplings at Sundaejip. Usually, there is a dumpling shop next to the sundae shop, so if you talk, the owner's mother will take care of the dumplings.
Sundae Dumpling Alley
Delicious hand dumplings are also cheap. Meat dumplings are 5 1,000 won and kimchi dumplings are 7 1,000 won, so if you have a few thousand won, you can eat them abundantly.
Market-rich food
Even around the alley, there are many shops selling dumplings, sundae, potato cakes, and snacks, so you can choose from a variety of menus to suit your taste.
Market-rich food
Let's fully appreciate the attractiveness of the market at a reasonable price.
Market-rich food
In the history of Mayor Chungju
The history of Muhak Market, which is always visited by many people, such as Sundae Alley, has been around since 1978. When protests broke out in the process of cracking down on street vendors who had been in the position of the old gardening cooperative in Chung-in-dong, they settled in the current Muhak market by moving shopping malls in Munhwa-dong and Bongbang-dong. The Chungju Public Market leading to the Muhak Market was opened in 1964 in accordance with the government's market policy for small merchants.
Muhak market leading to free market
The Sundae Alley connected with the Muhak Market is famous, and there have been several restaurants. Many stores sell foods such as vegetables, fish, and chicken.
Public market leading to free market
On the other hand, the small and quiet Chungui Market is a traditional market naturally formed in the place where 5 days of market continued from the free market.
arcade
The fruit and vegetable market and the alley alley were formed, and in the 1970s, there was a Chungju court market, so it was a commercial district. However, as the agricultural and fisheries wholesale market opened and the fruits and vegetables stores relocated, commercial districts are not the same now. Stores dealing with souvenir goods, pottery shops, and mills are mainly gathered, so people's feet are not frequent.
Seating area
Let's meet Chungju Poongmul Market along with Free Market, Muhak Market, Public Market, and Chungui Market. The Pungmul Market along Gyohyeoncheon is open on the 5th, 5th, 10th, 15th, 20th, 25th, and 30th each month.
Comfortable market atmosphere
Originally, it was a naturally formed 5-day market around Yeseong Park, but moved to its current location in 2001. You can find a variety of products and food.
Chungju market map
There is another spot you should not miss while looking around the market in Chungju. It is the Samhwa Forge in Nuri Market, not far from Muhak Market and Free Market. This is a meaningful place with the history of Mayor Chungin-dong. You can feel the past scenery of Chungil-dong scattered by blacksmiths.
Samhwa Grand Forge, which has the No. 13 night market in Chungbuk
The building itself is modern, but the traditional blacksmithing remains when you step inside. Kim Myung-il, designated as the 13th Intangible Cultural Property in Chungbuk, is still making iron tools by hand quenching and hammering.
Samhwa Grand Forge, which has the No. 13 night market in Chungbuk
You can purchase high-quality and solid objects created by the intangible cultural property, and you can also experience forge. The well-established Samhwa Blacksmith owner Nobubu always welcomes guests who come to watch.
Samhwa Grand Forge, which has the No. 13 night market in Chungbuk

item.title: Chungju's delicious home, here it is ~ - Chungju, Chungbuk, Korea
item.description:
Freshly cooked rice

Chungju's delicious home, here it is ~

Chungju, Chungbuk, Korea

Terms that describe good restaurants such as model restaurants, local restaurants, recommended restaurants, Daemulim restaurants, food restaurants, top restaurants, and TV broadcast restaurants vary by region. The expression I stumbled across the city of Chungju a while ago in Chungju was 'Good Rice House'. Chungcheongbuk-do has been implemented since 2013. In Chungju City, a movie restaurant, Cheonnyeonhyang, Manna Rice House, and Sato Bonga were selected.
Sanchaejeongsik Indulge in its pure taste, Suanbo 'Movie Restaurant'
Even before the Maika boom in Korea, this restaurant was rumored to be delicious. Even now, he continues his reputation and has also been on the list of “Best Houses with Good Rice” selected by Chungcheongbuk-do Province.
Suanbo Movie Restaurant Exterior
When I visited the movie restaurant opened in 1980 and wondered about the process of cooking, I readily agree. As soon as the three-person family ordered a set meal, they put a stone pot on the gas fire and put the soaked rice. Pour water over it and add 3 more beans. This is a common sight. When the rice water starts to boil, the aunt in charge of cooking the rice takes a small amount of the rice and adjusts the amount. It is said to be the only method of movie restaurant. Rice is purchased from Suanbo Agricultural Cooperatives. Soybeans are used in the summer in a mixture of three types: hedge beans, frost tae, juwolyangdae, and peas. It takes about 15 minutes for delicious rice to be completed. Immediately after cooking, the miso soup is served on another gas fire. When it boils, rice is finished.
3 beans in rice
During this process, while the rice is being cooked, the side dish chef puts 30 herbs into a small dish. Each dish is labeled with herbs. Let's list the names of herbs you can taste at the movie restaurant. 쐬 dung (Wang-Wook-Wait), Shun-Wa-Hu, Shun-Bae-Hu-Jae, Castor, Goulgi, Bakgo-Ji, Darae-Soon, Eom-Ri, Shunnamul, Mountain Mulberry Leaf, Sesame Leaf, Seaweed Snack, Sari-Soon, Eom-Soon-Moon, Snack-Eat, Black Duck, Snake, Fern , Shiitake mushrooms, bento (simmer), etc. The herbs that rise on the guest statue depend on the season and the amount of herbs collected.
Soybean rice stimulates salivary glands
The owner of the restaurant said, “We use herbs collected from Wolaksan or Sobaeksan. We endeavor to secure herbs from late March to early May. I take pride in the fact that I have never been. ”
Guests who enjoy the mountain set meal in the movie restaurant
Regular customers often eat rice with various vegetables and rice in a large bowl after ordering a set meal (16,000 won). However, the way to eat really delicious is not to rub, but pick up each herb with chopsticks to feel the unique taste and aroma. If you want to eat it, it is said to eat rice, herbs, and sesame oil. Do not add red pepper paste or doenjang stew soup.
Business hours from 8 am to 9 pm. Closed on New Year's Day and Chuseok.
The name of the herb is written on each bowl of herbs.
Medicinal constitutional rice is used to soothe Yeoksu, Yeonsu-dong 'Cheonnyanghyang'
'Food and drug mobilization (食 藥 同 原)'. Rice and medicine have the same roots, so if you meet good food on the road, you will feel tired. When you enter Cheonnyeonhyang, one of the ‘good-tasting homes’ in Chungju, the smell of medicinal herbs is soft. This restaurant is famous for its medicinal herb constitutional rice. It is run by Park Dong-soo, a holder of a health food prescription license. Above all, it is unique that customers can order and eat rice according to their constitution. Sitting in front of the sieve discriminator and recognizing the ten-finger print, it turns out that he is the owner of one of the constitutions: Taeinin, Taeumin, Soyangin, and Soumin.
Fingerprint recognition constitution discriminator at the entrance to Cheonnyeonhyang
Now customers can choose the type of food according to their constitution. In the dining room kitchen, cook rice cooked from a variety of grains and seeds. Rice water also uses herbal decoction water suitable for constitution. It is also fun to read the instructions on the back of the sieve while food is served.
Men's rice suitable for men
-Good food for Taein people: rice, flour, barley, black sesame, glucose, Chinese cabbage, kale, cucumber, seaweed, shrimp, shellfish, crab, mugwort, persimmon, apricot, green tea, ogapi, shochu
-Good food for Taeeumin: Rice, brown rice, whole wheat flour, glutinous rice, chajo, sorghum, red beans, peanuts, yulmu, potato, bellflower, deodeok, lotus root, burdock, eggplant, pumpkin, seaweed, beef, watermelon, chestnut, walnut, pine nut , Bank, caring
-Good food for Soyangin: rice, mung bean, barley, black sesame, peanut, cabbage, spinach, radish, buttercup, radish, lotus root, burdock, pork, beef, egg, seafood, pear, persimmon, grape, strawberry, goji, beer
-Foods good for Soumin: Rice, brown rice, glutinous rice, sweet potato, Chinese cabbage, spinach, onion, ginger, garlic, red pepper, wild vegetables, seaweed, seaweed, chicken, apple, tangerine, orange, peach, jujube, ginseng, antler
Women's rice suitable for women
If you order a meal for a thousand years, it is based on herbal idea constitutional rice.
In this restaurant, herbal medicine constitutional rice is called 'millennial rice cake'. The Unam set meal (15,000 won) comes with medicinal rice porridge, 3 kinds of appetizers, Sasang constitutional rice with 17 dishes, seafood sundubu jjigae, and a herbal tea that fits the constitution. Poppy Daebotang comes up. Yakseonguibidaebotang is a food made from 16 kinds of herbs, boiled with shiitake, top, leek, leek, carrot, celery, ginseng, jujube, three roots, burdock, Angelica leaves, and beef.
Formal table top with herbal medicine soup
In addition to the millennium class, there is also a medicine line yin and yang class. Different grains, seeds, and herbal decoctions are used to cook rice according to gender, such as Yin-in (female) and Yang-in (male). There are four types: Woosul Chosik (15,000 won), Yongdam Chosik (20,000 won), Sambaek Chosik (25,000 won), and Millennium Chosik (35,000 won).
Hasuo black sesame skin
Even the herbal teas that come out as desserts are made differently according to gender. The man is provided with a lively train with Goji wolfberry, augusti, and hasoo, and a woman with Onbi aberration with baekchul, astragalus, dermis, and cinnamon. The sweet taste is preserved with licorice. I would have known about my constitution, which I didn't know so far. After eating a low-sodium diet made of fermentation enzymes and herbal powder, I even feel like I'm taking a remedy.
Business hours from 10 am to 10 pm. Closed on 2nd and 4th Sundays (September 1, 2015, except for the Lunar New Year and Chuseok holidays).
Sancho Salad
Morning breakfast with Hwangtae bean sprouts soup soup
The restaurant's name is 'Manna Rice House', but many people are confused with 'Mana Rice House'. The people of Chungju said that if they drank excessively the previous day or had no appetite, they would use a bowl of Haejangguk to loosen the bitter stomach and sweat. Restaurant owner Eun-sook Kim has been running Haejanggukjib for 23 years near the Chungju Courthouse and has moved on to its reputation five years ago.
Manna Rice House Entrance
It's Haejanggukjip. In all cities, why was this restaurant selected as a “good rice house”? I'm curious about how to cook the rice after eating the ingredients of Haejangguk. Once rice is grown in the Chungbuk region, it is supplied from the Agricultural Cooperatives in Chungju. Add a little bit of millet to make the rice taste better. And use a pressure cooker with 12 servings. If you use a larger rice cooker, it will be difficult to maintain the proper taste. That is the secret of delicious rice.
Information on the “Good Rice House” at the Manna Rice House
Haejangguk is cooked with yellow persimmon oil in perilla oil, and then cooks the broth for about 20 hours. Add boiled sprouts, eggs, and yellow beans to it, and add perilla powder. The soup is white and the taste is savory. Gangwon-do Hwangtae Haejangguk and Jeonju Bean Sprout Haejangguk are different flavors. Perilla oil and perilla powder met to create the flavor of Haejangguk, a unique restaurant. Seasoning with shrimp sauce and dipping green pepper in a side dish of kkakdugi makes it easier for the stomach to feel uncomfortable with a few drinks last night. You can also try barley rice and mungdu samgyetang (reserved 2 hours before summer).
Hwangtae bean sprouts with soup
Business hours from 6:30 am to 9 pm. Closed on Sundays and New Year's Day and Chuseok.
Side dishes for customers ordering barley rice
Bringing back the feeling of hometown with Cheonggukjang
From Sancheok-myeon Office, go to Jungwon Golf Course about 3km and you will find a restaurant called Sato Bonga. "The three things are important to making rice well," said Park Hyup-gyu, CEO of the restaurant, which opened in 2003. The first good rice, the second rice time, the third steaming time. It uses rice produced in the Chungbuk region and cooks 20 servings of rice in a caster. When steaming, put a pot on top of the rice cooker lid to get the pressure cooker effect. The steaming time is about 30 minutes. Seasonal rice is mixed with chajo, millet, and black rice.
The appearance of Sato Bonga where Cheonggukjang is delicious
This carefully cooked rice meets the savory Cheonggukjang, which has little odor, and becomes a whole meal. Cheonggukjang floats two or three times a week, and the amount is about two horses (14kg) at a time. Soybeans are also farmed and used by local residents. Since no imported beans are used, one bowl of Cheonggukjang is 8,000 won, which is 1,000 to 2,000 won more expensive than the other. Boil tofu, radish, zucchini, old paper, green onion, cheonyang pepper, and onion in cheonggukjang. Neither anchovies nor pork. The taste of Cheonggukjang is still alive.
Sato Bonga's Cheonggukjang
As a dessert, Nurungji Sung-guk is served. I don't need any other dessert because I eat the salty paper that I made last fall as a side dish. In addition to the fresh cheonggukjang (4 pack 1kg 15,000 won), cheonggukjanghwan and cheonggukjang powder are also sold. We also prepared charcoal grilled meats for customers who like meat, and grilled yellow beans for customers who don't like Cheonggukjang.
Nurungji Soong-myeon
Business hours from 9 am to 9 pm. No holidays (closed for a long period from early December to New Year's holidays).
Cheonggukjang products sold in restaurants

item.title: Meet the History of Chungju Blooming along the Namhan River - Chungju, Chungbuk, South Korea
item.description:
Jodong-ri History Museum

Meet the History of Chungju Blooming along the Namhan River

Chungju, Chungbuk, South Korea

Chungju Chungju is the hometown of Jungwon culture. Prehistoric remains remain around the Namhan River, and in the Three Kingdoms era, it was a fierce battlefield to occupy Jungwon. It is also the place where Jungwongyeong was made among the 5 blind spots since the Three Kingdoms period. In January, a large amount of bronze artifacts from the early Iron Age were excavated in Hoam-dong, Chungju. In the early Iron Age tomb 19 artifacts were excavated all at once, including the Sejong bronze sword. Let's meet Chungju's history from prehistoric times to Goryeo dynasty along the Namhan River, which is dotted with intense historical traces and various ruins.
Meet the Bronze Artist's Life 3000 Years ago
Since ancient times, the place where there is water has always been a place of people's living. Even now, prehistoric people who lived and settled in have chosen a place with water to live. The prehistoric ruins of Jodong-ri, located in Dongyang-myeon, Chungju-si, are large village ruins from the Neolithic Age to the Bronze Age, based on the Namhan River. The large river called Namhan River and the alluvial plains created by the flooding were suitable for people to live. Prehistoric ruins date back to approximately 7000 years. Since the Neolithic began to live for the first time, the Bronze activists continued their agricultural life 3000 years ago.
Excavation and ruins of Jodong-ri History Museum
Jodong-ri History Museum is located adjacent to the entrance of Dongyang-myeon and Namhan River. It is a place where you can see the discovery process of Jo Dong-ri and various relics. It is composed of Jodong-ri History and Culture Center on the 1st floor, Jodong-ri Farming Room on the 2nd floor, and Memorial Hall for Huh Mun-hoe, agronomist.
Bronzeman's Whirlwind
The prehistoric ruins of Jo Dong-ri became known to the world as the ruins were exposed in 1990 due to heavy rain. Over the next ten years, some of the ruins of the Neolithic era, as well as the ruins of the Bronze Age, as well as the burning seats and huts were excavated. The ruins reveal that prehistoric people lived on a large scale in villages and active farming.
Diorama showing the bronze life
When you cross the bridge made of tempered glass that reproduces the scene of the excavation, you will meet the dioramas that tell the life of the time based on the ruins of the excavated house, umyu-gu, and the seat of burning, earthenware and grains. It is a place where you can spread your imagination through the excavated artifacts. A huge diorama of the bronze fighter who lived in a large village based on the topography of Jodong-ri. The life of the Bronze Age unfolds like a panorama of catching fish or farming by the river, raising livestock, harvesting fruit, and burning pots and baking earthenware.
Diorama showing the bronze life
You can also see the bronze life of the bronze fighter. This is a reconstruction of the 7th house found at Jo Dong-ri Prehistoric Site. The figure shows a man who trims the net, a child who grinds grains and shreds, and a woman who bakes fish on fire.
Diorama showing the bronze life
Unification Rice with Green Revolution Found in Prehistoric Ruins
Jodong-ri Agricultural Room on the 2nd floor of the museum is a place where you can examine the use of agricultural artifacts discovered in Jodong-ri and the grains of the time. You can see the picture of the moisturizer used to plow the ground, the vandal knife and scythe used to cut the grain, and the use of the reeds and reed used to peel the fruit or grind grain. Among them, care was not only used to plow the land, but also a multifunctional tool that played a role as a shovel and a hoe. Wouldn't it be MacGyver knife these days? In the ruins of Jo Dong-ri, various traces of grain were excavated. Wheat was the largest with 723 eggs, and barley and rice, rice, rice, and park and peach seeds were also found. Most of them are carbonized, but it's easy to see the grain from 3000 years ago.
Bronze Engineer Farm Equipment Moisturizing Restoration
Next to the farm room is a place in commemoration of Dr. Huh Mun-hui, a farmer from Chungju. Dr. Huh, who has made great contributions to Korean agricultural history, has developed a unified rice that opened the rice self-sufficiency era. In Korea, there were four springs, often called “barley hills,” until the 1970s. It was a country that mainly produces rice, but most people did not have a warm meal.
Carbonized barley found in Jodong-ri prehistoric ruins
Unification rice is a hybrid of Japanese and Taiwanese rice varieties, and is a cultivar developed by three-way breeding of IR8, which was nurtured by the International Rice Research Institute. Rice grown in Korea was weak against wind and pests, and the yield was very low a year. Since the unification of rice since 1972, rice self-sufficiency rate has surpassed 100% with increasing production.
Unification rice developed by Dr. Huh Moon Hoe
Considering the time when we worried about meals 40 years ago, is our life too undeserved? Nowadays, when rice consumption remains unprecedented, it's a good idea to reflect on Barley Hill's days. In that sense, the commemoration room for the agronomist Humunmun teacher is a meaningful place.
Agronomist
Rustic stones that meet at the central tower flowing through the Namhan River
Various traces from the Three Kingdoms Period to the Goryeo Dynasty remain around the Namhan River, which flows through the Chungju Jungang Pagoda to Yeoju. Crossing Tangeum Bridge is Changdong-ri, the first town in the middle of Pagoda. In Changdong-ri, there are simple, majestic stone towers of the Koryo Dynasty, stone Buddhas, and Mae Buddha.
Chungju Changdong-ri Maaebul View
If you cross the Tangeum Bridge for about 1km, you will meet Maebul, Changdong-ri, Chungju to the right. It's a magic fire carved on a rock wall facing the Namhan River over a small hill. As you climb the hill past the entrance, you will see a steep staircase leading down the river. He unintentionally descends the stairs and is amazed by the appearance of a huge 4 meter tall Buddha. A friendly and stern expression and harsh expression are typical of the Buddha's love. It seems to be a Buddhist image that wishes for the well-being of those who cross the boat by the Mae Fire, which is seen from the Namhan River flowing toward Yeoju.
Changae-ri Maaebul overlooking the Namhan River
The five-story stone pagoda in Changdong-ri and the stone statue of a stone pharmacist are standing side by side within 200m from Changae-ri Maaebul. It is easy to find the Jungwon Party that makes Cheong Myeongju designated as Chungbuk Intangible Cultural Property No.2.
Five-storied pagoda and Changjo pharmacy
Changdong-ri Five Storeyed Stone Pagoda and Stone Carved Buddha Statue are also known for the Goryeo Dynasty. The stone statue of the stone pharmacist is carved from the pharmacist's standing standing on the big stone. If Chang Dong-ri's Ma-a-bul has a blunt look, the pharmacist's statue is a cute figure with a gentle smile on his vivid face.
Gentle smile of stone statue
The five-storied pagoda has a slim pagoda on a thick two-story podium, as if two other stones were placed on it. The stone pagoda is from a nearby abandoned site, and the pharmacist statue was taken from a nearby abandoned mine. Standing side by side in a narrow open space, it offers simple yet splendid scenery.
Chungju Changdong-ri Five-story Stone Tower
Along the way from the Chungju-guguryeo Vision Exhibition Center to the Chungju-gugur Astronomical Science Museum, if you cross the hill, you will reach Bongwang-ri. On the way up the iron rod that runs along the Hanpocheon flowing into the Namhan River, there is Mae Buddha statue in Bongwangri, Chungju designated as treasure 1401.
Bonghuangri Maae Buddha Statue
Climbing steep stone staircase and iron staircase leads to the first rock climbing with 8 hearts. Various Buddha statues are engraved, including chants, offerings, and bodhisattva statues.
Travelers looking at Penghuangri Maae Buddha Statue
It was difficult to find all eight Buddha statues because it was built in the Three Kingdoms period and endured a long time. As if you are searching for hidden pictures, you can find them by looking at them one by one.
Statues and chants of the Phoenix Buddha

item.description:
Samtan Station and Chungbuk Line Train

Take the train, Chungju Samtan Amusement Park & Indeungsan

Chungju, Chungbuk, South Korea

Water play that reminds me of summer and water play in scenic nature is a fresh play. With the romantic romance of the train, the pleasure of traveling multiplies, regardless of time.
In front of the train station, Samtan Amusement Park where water, forest and mountains are combined. Camping is easy to leave, and it is easy to use the accommodations that are located next to the amusement park. It is also a good idea to have a regular mountain climbing mountain. On the way back, enjoy sightseeing near Chungju Station, and your trip will be more enriching. Let's leave by train, Chungju!
Jupocheon from the Samtan Bridge
Samtan Amusement Park by train track
Samtan Amusement Park is located at Sancheok-myeon, Chungju-si, Chungbuk. The train to Samtan Amusement Park is good. This is because there is an amusement park about 500 meters from Samtan Station. Pass the Samtan Bridge right in front of the station and follow the road to Myeongdol Village. Samtan means three streams, such as government office, pine and barnacle. Jupocheon, which leads to the Namhan River, flows around the amusement park.
Myeongdol Village Entrance Seats and Sports Park
In the past, the people were rare enough to stay with them, but in 1958 trains passing through Samtan Station were extended to form villages and amusement parks. In June 2000, a sports park was created next to the amusement park. Recently, a natural grass soccer field has been set up in the center of the park. Most of the facilities in the amusement park can be used free of charge, but lawn parks require a maintenance fee after booking.
Athletic Park
In addition to the turf field, the vacant lot can also be used as a camping ground. The large campsite makes it easy to find a place to go. There are also facilities such as toilet, drinking fountain and parking lot.
Jopocheon and amusement park gravel under the train tracks

The malls along the funfair ramp combine restaurants, canteens and bed and breakfasts. You can rent or buy some fishing gear as well as some simple fishing gear. Every summer, residents work together to improve the environment around the park. This year, from July 16th to August 15th, an environmental information center and Saemaul Library will be run by 200 residents. The Environmental Information Center is a voluntary activity that creates a clean environment for vacationers by removing garbage and collecting recyclables around the amusement park. Saemaul Library has over 2,000 books available for free rental and leads a healthy holiday culture. Residents in charge of the river reside in preparation for safety accidents.

Midsummer Willow

The amusement park is surrounded by mountains, and the odd rock cliffs are superbly located across the main stream. The river is wide and the water level is varied, so it is good for children to adults. Gravel fields spread out next to the sports park. There is a lush forest on top of it, and rich trees such as willows make the shade.

Amusement park next to sports park
Receive the energy of three
Indeungsan is a 667m high mountain located just behind the amusement park. It belongs to Cheondeungsan (807m) in the north and Jideungsan (535m) in the south, and belongs to Samdeungsan which means Cheon, Ji, and Injae. Sandeungsan is known for being sheltered from the mountains and deep in valleys. In addition, the legend is said that if one crosses all three mountains, one wish will be fulfilled.
Train passing railroad crossing by the amusement park
Cheondeungsan Mountain is named after the top of the mountain. The trail is not easy. Along with Bakdaljae, he became famous as a popular song <Crying Bakdaljae>, but in fact, about 9km away from Cheondeungsan and Wonseocheon, it belongs to Mt.
Samtan Amusement Park from the Beginning of the Trail
Jideung Mountain is a mountain that is connected to Indeung Mountain. In climbing is a mountain that can be climbed without difficulty. While walking to the summit, the scenery is beautiful, and on a good day, you can look down to Chungju Lake.
Forest road heading to the observatory
When the weather is too hot, it's a good idea to walk along the forest road to the observation deck.
Hiking trail by the valley
It is about 3km from Samtan Amusement Park to Observation Deck. Passing the mall opposite the amusement park leads you to the apple orchard. When you enter the road, you will be able to walk around the mountain. Do not enter the valley road, it is good to follow the road. There are no milestones on the mountain trail next to the valley, so you can wander around.
Observation Deck 700m
If you climb about 1.7km from the entrance, you will come to a three-way street. Follow the signs to the right for about 700m to reach the observatory. If you climb the observatory, you can see the Cheondeungsan Mountain opposite you and face the river flowing under the mountain.
The area of Jideungsan from the Cheonjiin Observatory
The train tracks seen from the mountain are also superb views.
Village seen from the observation deck
Chungju caliber on the way back

Before heading home, let's go from Samtan Station to Chungju Station in time for the train. Jungang Top Park is located about 7km from Chungju Station. It is called the tower in the center of Korea. Its historical name is Joongwon Papyeong-ri Seven-storied pagoda. It is the largest stone pagoda in the Unified Shilla Era. It is currently designated as National Treasure No. 6. In 1992, a historic park was built around the pagoda, and in 2007, the park facility was built along with the reorganization and repair work around the central pagoda. Inside the park are Chungju Museum 1 and 2, an open-air museum and a music hall. A music fountain is installed on Tangeum Lake in front of the park.

Next to the park is the World Liquor Museum. Visit the Wine History and Culture Museum for information about wine. There is also an experience facility where you can listen to the whiskey ripening process and taste the whiskey in oak barrels. A collection of beers, spirits, and oriental alcohol from around the world. The liquor of our country attracts people's attention by displaying traditional and modern wine more carefully. In addition to the exhibition halls, a separate education center will be operated and mainstream culture and fermentation science experiences will be conducted. Anyone can join in advance.
Jungwon Tappyeong Seven-storied Pagoda in Jungang Pagoda Park
There are many charming restaurants around the museum. Next door is Tangeumho International Rowing Center. Tangeum Lake was formed during the construction of Chungju Dam in 1985. Until 2004, the stadium was used as a water sports park for the general public and as a training ground for rowers. In summer, the Chungju Lake Festival is held in this area, and water sports activities are free for the general public.
Museum of World Liquor Culture
